page.title: 01 Introduction to the Area
page.content: The main occupation is agricultural mixed farming with crops of cereals, potatoes and oil seed rape combined with the rearing of cattle and sheep. A notable feature in May is the large number of fields covered in bright yellow oil seed rape flowers. In the NW corner is the edge of{ Mears Ashby} village and in the SW corner are the northern outskirts of{ Earls Barton} consisting mainly of an industrial estate comprising factories & workshops.The edge of{ Doddington} village lies in the SE of the area. The principal village is{ Wilby} which stretches along a main road & is separated from{ Wellingborough} by a roundabout & a field. It has a shop,a school, a Working Men's Club and two public houses.Although the main road divides the village in two it still retains its village atmosphere.
